xxl.core.pipes.operators.joins
Class IndexJoin<I,O>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,O>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.joins.IndexJoin<I,O>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,O>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<O>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class IndexJoin<I,O>
extends AbstractPipe<I,O>

Operator component in a query graph that computes the join between a stream and multi-set. This algorithm abstracts from the datastructure that manages the elements of a multi-set, therefore even index-structures can be accessed by this pipe.
The implementor has to specify two functions for a multi-set:

  • a query-function (qf: Object --> Iterator) that returns an iterator of all elements corresponding to the given element.
  • a parameterless close-function that closes the datastructure managing the multi-set.
The construction of this join operation's resulting tuples can also be influenced by specifying a binary function, called newResult. This function is applied to an incoming element and a result returned by the iterator of the query-function.

Example usage (1): 

        Enumerator e1 = new Enumerator(0, 10000, 0);
 
        // querying a cursor, e.g. a database table
        Cursor cursor = new xxl.cursors.Enumerator(1000);
        IndexJoin join1 = new IndexJoin(e1, cursor, Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, Tuplify.DEFAULT_INSTANCE);
        new Tester(join1);

Example usage (2): 

        Enumerator e2 = new Enumerator(0, 100, 0);
 
        // querying an index, in this example a BTree
        int minCap = 5;
        int maxCap = 10;
        int bufferSize = 100;
 
        final BTree btree = new BTree();
        final BufferedContainer container = new BufferedContainer(
                new ConverterContainer(
                        new BlockFileContainer("BTree", 4+2+16*maxCap),
                        btree.nodeConverter(IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, ComparableComparator.DEFAULT_INSTANCE)
                ),
                new LRUBuffer(bufferSize),
                true
        );
        // initialize the BTree with the descriptor-factory method, a
        // container for storing the nodes and the minimum and maximum
        // capacity of them
        btree.initialize(
                new Function () {
                        public Object invoke (Object object) {
                                return new AbstractInterval1D(object);
                        }
                },
                container, minCap, maxCap
        );
        Iterator it = new xxl.cursors.Enumerator(10000);
        new SortBasedBulkLoading(btree, it,     new Constant(container));
 
        IndexJoin join2 = new IndexJoin(e2,
                new Function() {
                        public Object invoke(Object object) {
                                return btree.query(new AbstractInterval1D(object));
                        }
                },
                new Function() {
                        public Object invoke() {
                                container.close();
                                return null;
                        }
                },
                Tuplify.DEFAULT_INSTANCE
        );
        new Tester(
                new Mapper(join2,
                        new Function() {
                                public Object invoke(Object o) {
                                        System.out.println(((Object[])o)[0]+", "+((Object[])o)[1]);
                                        return o;
                                }
                        }
                )
        );

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Predicate, Function, Cursor

                 int sourceID,
                 Function queryFunction,
                 Function closeFunction,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new IndexJoin as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
sourceID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
queryFunction - Unary query-function that determines all matches for a given element in the multi-set.
qf: Object --> Iterator
closeFunction - Parameterless function that closes the underlying multi-set.
newResult - Binary function constructing the join-results, i.e. tuples.

public IndexJoin(Source<? extends I> source,
                 Function queryFunction,

Creates a new IndexJoin as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription.

qf: Object --> Iterator

IndexJoin

public IndexJoin(Source<? extends I> source,
                 int sourceID,
                 Cursor cursor,
                 Predicate predicate,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new IndexJoin as an internal component of a query graph. The underlying multi-set is a Cursor, that has to be resetable.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
sourceID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
cursor - Cursor that has to be resetable.
predicate - Binary predicate that is true, if an incoming element corresponds to an element of the cursor, otherwise false.
newResult - Binary function constructing the join-results, i.e. tuples.

IndexJoin

public IndexJoin(Source<? extends I> source,
                 Cursor cursor,
                 Predicate predicate,
                 Function newResult)
Creates a new IndexJoin as an internal component of a query graph. The underlying multi-set is a Cursor, that has to be resetable.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The input rate and the output rate are not measured.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
cursor - Cursor that has to be resetable.
predicate - Binary predicate that is true, if an incoming element corresponds to an element of the cursor, otherwise false.
newResult - Binary function constructing the join-results, i.e. tuples.
Method Detail

processObject

public void processObject(I o,
                          int sourceID)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
The unary query-function is applied to the given element. The resulting iterator is used to build the tuples that are transferred as join-results to all subscribed sinks of this pipe. The implementation is as follows: 

        Iterator results = (Iterator)queryFunction.invoke(o);
        while(results.hasNext()) {
                Object next = results.next();
                super.transfer(newResult.invoke(o, next));
        }

Specified by:
processObject in class AbstractPipe<I,O>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - One of The IDs this pipe specified during its subscription by the underlying sources.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

close

public void close()
Calls super.close() and invokes the closeFunction.

Specified by:
close in interface Source<O>

main

The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.
